alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 09 at 6:05AM MDT until May 10 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE EASTERN PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds will strengthen again Tuesday afternoon with south and southwest wind gusts reaching 35 mph amongst long duration single digit minimum relative humidity and unstable conditions. Critical fire weather conditions will favor the northeast highlands, with locally elevated conditions expected elsewhere. Critical to extreme fire weather conditions are likely Wednesday over all but the eastern plains with a very unstable airmass and strong to damaging wind gusts as high as 55 or 60 mph. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from noon to 8 pm MDT on Tuesday. On Wednesday from 11 am to 10 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 mph Tuesday afternoon and evening. South to southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to near 55 or 60 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent Tuesday. About 8 to 10 hours of single digit humidity is forecast Tuesday. 10 to 15 percent on Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
